body: Hi guys, After that Chris solved my problem with the glazing system, I made a step forward. I started to set up the materials of the opaque parts, A, of the facade system. [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/aRMdvpURD3mKD*Xz03UYNaMPiOKmbFZB-2ZKEe-i3ZQLxnvm6SEP04YE5qR9hvNrHCyHpUDP6hEj7lsuUNKyeYWo-nZLDR7J/BuildingEnvelope_concept.JPG) The opaque system is made of two layers: - PCM material; - Metal panel. I used a part of script that I found in the discussion forum to create a PCM material and add the additional strings required in the Energy Plus simulation. Can anyone tell me if all it's right? Thanks to all you guys.
topic: TEST ROOM_ENERGY ANALYSIS SET UP_PCM setting + Metal materials

replies.body: The easiest way to check if it's assigned correctly is to write the idf file and check the text file. Find the surface object and see if the construction is assigned correctly.
